metadata.title: Arvaya Consulting | Weekly Friday Team sync

transcript.speaker: Todd Fernley
transcript.text: I used to have, like, MacBooks, and my favorite one was 2011 before they started soldering in the motherboard.

transcript.speaker: Todd Fernley
transcript.text: I kind of, like, aligned those two of them where it's, like, able to customize, and then other cars are just not as much.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: Yeah, so we did a full.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: We replaced every wheel well, the bumper, both bumpers, and the headlights.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: Just me and a buddy in, like, three hours.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: But if you tried to do that on my car now, you'd hate yourself because I replaced my alternator and it took me eight hours.

transcript.speaker: Todd Fernley
transcript.text: I have to replace this thing called a blend door, which is a thing that fails in Wranglers, and it requires taking apart the entire dashboard, so I'm.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: Wow, that is some solid lip reading skills.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: I'll be sure to cover my mouth when I want to talk bad about you.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: I'm gonna be on mute because my father doesn't stop answering the phone, so you got to.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: He's got too many people calling.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: You'll be kind of leading this meeting.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: And he's a loud talker, isn't he?

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: Ryan, the apple did not fall, but nothing in the tree.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: I'll mute and let you run in the Mark.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: Ryan, are we waiting for Ashley?

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: I mean, yeah, we can wait a.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: Couple minutes, but I think Zach is traveling.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: Addie and Rachel, how was the.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: Can't wait to join you guys soon.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: Let's go ahead and get started.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: Just as a reminder, these syncs that we have throughout the week, the agenda may change whoever's putting them on the calendar.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: So just kind of ahead of time, check the.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: Call in teams and see what the agenda's gonna be about.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: And that way, you're ready to rock and roll.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: This one for today is just the wins, what's blocking you, what may have slipped or moved forward properly, and any priorities.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: At the at the top of my window here if you want to kick us.

transcript.speaker: Todd Fernley
transcript.text: How am I always at the top?

transcript.speaker: Todd Fernley
transcript.text: Shouldn't I be at the bottom?

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: He's always the first one in the meeting.

transcript.speaker: Todd Fernley
transcript.text: So yeah, it's first week going.

transcript.speaker: Todd Fernley
transcript.text: The one thing I'll say from a win from this week I've been attending the special tech meetings.

transcript.speaker: Todd Fernley
transcript.text: I'm only just sitting in, I'm just listening in.

transcript.speaker: Todd Fernley
transcript.text: But the good thing that's coming out of that is I've built out a.

transcript.speaker: Todd Fernley
transcript.text: Right now it's very archaic and it's an Excel but a pipeline tracker for all potential clients.

transcript.speaker: Todd Fernley
transcript.text: And I'm building it out in the overall structure by what the feedback we're getting and the approach that we're taking with Spectra Tech.

transcript.speaker: Todd Fernley
transcript.text: And then I'm going to mend that and then in the coming weeks migrate that to Monday.

transcript.speaker: Todd Fernley
transcript.text: So we all have that there.

transcript.speaker: Todd Fernley
transcript.text: But this is just a starting point so I'd say it's good.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: And for next week that's going to be continuing on that front.

transcript.speaker: Todd Fernley
transcript.text: So I've been using that not only for the meetings this week but also any of the documentation that we have from previous events hosted.

transcript.speaker: Todd Fernley
transcript.text: Getting all that information in one central location and be able to cross reference that and use that as kind of benchmarking moving forward.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: Okay, so Ice Monday.com is moving along, just have some small tweaks for that for next week and Elham really likes it.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: So I guess that's the win in that category because he hasn't seen it in you know, three, two months or something.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: So that got some direction on the kind of new.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: Well I guess it's not a new project yet but the Spectra Tech like their onboarding system that we may be building for them.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: So got some direction on that.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: We'll be working on the proposal this weekend to give to Ryan to actually propose to them.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: Kyle and I worked on a training resource and I'm just going to pull that up real quick because that's kind of like a very large win.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: Just going to show it off real quick.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: So it all feeds from this data which is obviously not complete yet, but the structure is the important component which is this.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: So this is how people would actually like view the data.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: So you got your main ideas or your categories, you then have like inside of that broken out into other categories and then if you go down another layer, you can click on it and then it's got a summary at the top, table of contents, key takeaways, embedded loom video, summary of the loom video flowchart, the content summary of the flowchart, and then any extra documentation resources to download right there.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: And to pair that into kind of.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: This whole thing is searchable and you can talk to it and try to ask it to find you what data or who made something, because you can assign ownership for it.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: So if something is not fully answering your question, you can see who's the contact of that system or the contact of the person who created the document and then reach out to them, which is maybe less important for us in the current moment, but might be a lot more important if we deploy this to clients.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: Because this is, in my opinion, very similar to like, Mind Tickle, and we can build it in Monday directly.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: And would this be something that's like per.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: You could have this knowledge base in each.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: In each kind of project board.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: I mean, it could be in the same environment.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: I just pulled it into, like a workspace, a demo workspace for me to work with, but it could be in this, if that's what you're talking about.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: It would be because it's all just training documents.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: So it's like, how to do this, how to do that.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: Looking forward to more of that.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: Next week, wrapping up the Spectra Tech proposal by Tuesday, wrapping up the Monday stuff by Thursday, and then importing their new data by Friday and evaluating if I can do what I did for this to replace Systemo and make a mileage tracking tool, because then we can pull all of ICE into Monday dot com.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: You just gave me shit for talking too much and I haven't heard you stop talking for the whole drive home.

transcript.speaker: David Hogg
transcript.text: Maybe speak about more work and it won't be as much of a problem.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: No, those are all good stuff, for sure.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: Well, Ryan, while you're unmuted, if you want to.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: If you want to talk, since you seem to want to talk.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: No, I, you know, you guys already kind of covered a lot of my stuff.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: You know, obviously, Spectra Tech, that's a awesome, you know, exciting opportunity.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: I mean, just hearing all the winds, I don't want to steal anybody's thunder.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: So can you keep on Keeping up inspector track.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: Spectral Tech is a done deal.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: So we're putting together a proposal.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: I know Zach is working on that.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: We'll have a meeting next to.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: We have a meeting next Tuesday to go over it.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: I was going to say if you could maybe just give us a quick blurb on them if it were already done, but we'll.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: We don't want to counter it.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: You don't want to count your chickens before they're hatched.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: Essentially, they work a lot in the Department of Energy.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: They have a very niche business and we're working on staff augmentation for them.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: So essentially just finding the right candidates when they respond to RFQs.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: So we got a pretty cool tool that Zach and David have been working on, or at least working on the structure of what it will look like.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: And then we'll be able to use that for us, too.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: Everybody but Todd, especially with us working in the government space soon, being able to respond to RFQs and have some of the contractors that we can, you know, find for us.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: So it'll be a good tool for us, too.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: We won't be prime on a lot of things for a while, so we'll be subcontracting anyway.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: Anyway, I won't go long winded on that, but good stuff for sure.

transcript.speaker: Kyle Dalton
transcript.text: Gained a lot of knowledge on our Monday on ice's Monday.

transcript.speaker: Kyle Dalton
transcript.text: Started building a lot of deliverables, sops, LOOM videos, Miro charts for both ICE and us working a lot on the ICE side, just with the deadline on the 16th, trying to get it done before that so we can all review it and make sure it aligns exactly with what they're needing.

transcript.speaker: Kyle Dalton
transcript.text: Um, but that'll be kind of my priority moving into next week is just tying up the rest of those LOOM videos and making a few more mirror charts.

transcript.speaker: Kyle Dalton
transcript.text: SOPs are barely done at this point other than advanced filtering and reporting, so.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: Have you worked with LOOM before?

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: I haven't used it yet myself.

transcript.speaker: Kyle Dalton
transcript.text: It takes a few times to get the video right how you want it to go, but once you.

transcript.speaker: Kyle Dalton
transcript.text: I mean, I feel I figured out Build yourself a little script.

transcript.speaker: Kyle Dalton
transcript.text: Make it a little easier rather than trying to go off the dome.

transcript.speaker: Rachael Lindblom
transcript.text: Finished creating everyone's bios or at least drafts to review with Ashley.

transcript.speaker: Rachael Lindblom
transcript.text: So short bios, long bios, and then basically just like key skills for everyone.

transcript.speaker: Rachael Lindblom
transcript.text: And then created that to an internal and external org chart to pull for any marketing stuff.

transcript.speaker: Rachael Lindblom
transcript.text: And then started working on the website Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, and then that'll be my focus going into next week and probably the week after that too.

transcript.speaker: Rachael Lindblom
transcript.text: And another one was working with Addie and Ashley yesterday, of course.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: As far as the website, are we expecting like a little overhaul or is that just some.

transcript.speaker: Rachael Lindblom
transcript.text: We like switched it over from the platform that you guys were using to wix and it'll be like a completely new look.

transcript.speaker: Rachael Lindblom
transcript.text: Like every team member will have their own page and more like in depth services.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: As soon as his profile page opens, it's just like.

transcript.speaker: admin
transcript.text: I've been just keeping Ashley alive.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: Well, keep up the good, good work there and that's a full time job and I'll swing in real quick.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: I've worked with Zachy earlier helping the AI LLM project move forward and gather some contact information for a call next week.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: We got some VP vantage point calls coming up next week.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: I worked with Brian and Linda on that as well.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: And also Monday.com designating statuses for the project.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: So we got the task level projects now we got project level statuses for that.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: And priorities for next week is just continuing on those initiatives and making sure the progress is moving forward.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: And Open Asset, we got the kickoff call next week, so that'll be fun.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: I think that might be a wrap.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: Ryan, you got anything else or anybody else have any Friday words of wisdom?

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: No, I mean, just love that everybody is working hard and these are all awesome wins.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: You know, excited for the new folks and crushing the first week.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: And no, I think we're ramping up.

transcript.speaker: Ryan Botindari
transcript.text: Loving that we have, you know, these prospects that we're working on and getting some new clients in the door and.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: And I forgot to mention, we got the dinner next week, so that's.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: Marble and Finn, I've never been there, so that'll be good.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: I heard it's really sounds fancy.

transcript.speaker: admin
transcript.text: I heard it's really, really good food.

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: Kyle, were you determined if you can make it?

transcript.speaker: Mark Lohr
transcript.text: All right, well, thank you all.
